summary: This bill, H.R. 334, seeks to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to address new technologies. It explicitly expands the Federal Communications Commission's (FCC) authority to regulate artificial and prerecorded voice systems to include those created using generative artificial intelligence, such as voice cloning. The amendment empowers the FCC to establish technical and procedural standards for these emerging AI voice technologies, aiming to protect consumers from potential misuse in automated telephone calls. The bill ensures that regulations keep pace with technological advancements in AI-generated communications.
